entities.name: barty
entities.description: Barty is mentioned as someone who knows the rule book back to front. He is described as beaming and turning back to Ka rkaroff and Madame Maxime.

entities.name: bagman
entities.description: Bagman is mentioned as saying that Barty knows the rule book back to front. He is described as beaming.

entities.name: karkaroff
entities.description: Karkaroff is mentioned as insisting upon resubmitting the names of his students. He is described as having dropped his unctuous tone and smile.

entities.name: madame maxime
entities.description: Madame Maxime is mentioned as being present when Bagman says that Barty knows the rule book back to front.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as being addressed by Karkaroff. He is described as being in a position of authority.

relationships.description: Karkaroff and Bagman disagree on how the Goblet of Fire works. Karkaroff insists that it should be reignited to allow more students to compete, while Bagman says it won't work like that.
Karkaroff appeals to Dumbledore, saying 'It's only fair' that each school has two champions.
